wikipedia_page.main:
Alan Seymour Davies (born 21 February 1947) is a former headmaster (so-called "superhead") of Copland Community School and Technology Centre Foundation 1988–2009. In 2000, he was made a Knight Bachelor for services to education.
In 2013, Davies was convicted of false accounting (fraud), and given a 12-month suspended sentence. Consequently, his knighthood was rescinded in 2014.

link_mentions.page: List of revocations of appointments to orders and awarded decorations and medals of the United Kingdom
response: *2014: Alan Seymour Davies, following his conviction for false accounting.
* Alan Seymour Davies, JP, Headteacher, Copland Community School and Technology Centre, Brent, London. For services to Education.
